articles.author: LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.title: Record numbers in the US are homeless. Can cities fine them for sleeping in parks and on sidewalks? - The Associated Press
articles.description: The most significant case in decades on homelessness has reached the Supreme Court as record numbers of people in America are without a permanent place to live. The justices on Monday will consider a challenge to rulings that found punishing people for sleepi…
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (AP) The most significant case in decades on homelessness has reached the Supreme Court as record numbers of people in America are without a permanent place to live.
